other_tests.date: During the second pregnancy (exact date not specified)
other_tests.findings: At 4 weeks gestation, FT3 and FT4 were slightly above elevated prepregnancy levels coinciding with elevated hCG. At 10 and 12 weeks gestation, TSH became undetectable.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Between 10 and 12 weeks gestation, FT3 and FT4 declined, and symptoms subsided. TSH remained below normal limits until 28 weeks gestation.

other_tests.date: At 10 weeks gestation (exact date not specified)
other_tests.findings: No measurable response of TSH to TRH.

other_tests.date: At 4 weeks of age (exact date not specified)
other_tests.findings: Confirmed presence of the TR/H9252 mutation R243Q.
